name: Encumbrance
description: This variant rule uses a more granular carrying capacity system with two encumbrance thresholds. Instead of simply having a carrying capacity limit, characters suffer penalties when carrying too much weight relative to their Strength score.

defaultCarryingCapacity.description: Without the variant rule, a creature can carry weight up to this limit with no penalty. Beyond this, the creature cannot move.

penalties: Disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that use Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution

mechanics.maximumCapacity: A creature still cannot carry more than its Strength score x 15 lbs. Beyond this limit, the creature cannot move.
mechanics.pushDragLift: A creature can push, drag, or lift a weight up to twice its carrying capacity (Strength score x 30 lbs). While pushing or dragging weight in excess of its carrying capacity, its Speed drops to 5 feet.

interactions: Characters with low Strength scores (spellcasters, Dexterity-focused rogues) are most impacted by encumbrance penalties
The heavily encumbered Disadvantage on Strength/Dexterity/Constitution saves is extremely punishing, affecting most combat-related saves
The Bear Totem Barbarian's carrying capacity feature and the Powerful Build trait double carrying capacity thresholds
Bags of Holding and similar extradimensional storage items become significantly more valuable under this variant
This rule encourages parties to manage inventory more carefully and make meaningful choices about what equipment to carry
Mounts and pack animals become more important for transporting gear
